titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 3150) to amend title 11 of the United States Code, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-799, by Mr. Linder.

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 3150 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Waiving points of order against the conference report and against its consideration.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 275.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/8/1998--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 3150 (consumer bankruptcy revisions).
